and i’m not talking about ms feedback or anything...like an editor recently said they were rejecting my pitch bc it wasn’t a 1st person piece. so of course i replied & explained that it was. but then they said it was too similar to something i’d written for another pub...

i hate editors who give bad reasons for rejecting a pitch. i’d rather get no reason, or a “not a right fit” type reply. when editors send rejections based on things that are incorrect or flexible, it makes me want to work on the pitch w them. but usually they just mean no.

my latest with  — nc is poised to join several other states in making actions taken during pregnancy grounds to remove a child from their family—but there’s still time to stop it: north carolina wants to make prenatal substance exposure a crime

if that’s happening, then people who use drugs aren’t going to want to go to your hospital. look i’m sorry if you don’t like the truth, but “safe drug disposal bins” aren’t helpful. not calling the police on patients is helpful, better yet not even searching them in the 1st place

alright way to get pedantic and avoid the real point. i hope patients aren’t leaving the hospital during hospitalization either—you said your staff call police when drugs are found, which can result in charges after they leave the hospital.

it’s bad policy, and if patients have been leaving your hospital in handcuffs at any point ever b/c of drug-related room searches, i guarantee your facility has a reputation for being unsafe for drug users, which certainly doesn’t help any “recovery-centered” goals.

i’ll stop spraying your feed after this one, promise! i just want to add that i don’t think this approach will, in fact, help even one patient. i mean i know if i threw my drugs in a safe disposal bin to avoid arrest in hospital, i’d then try to find a way to get them back out!
patient care should *always* be patient centered, which means not necessarily recovery-centered when it comes to drug use/addx

i’m curious who decides which rooms to search? is it every patient, on a schedule? is it patients at “random” and if the latter, any oversight to deter discrimination against poor ppl/poc/ppl stereotypically associated w/ drug use? are wealthy white drug users equally surveilled?

is it a law that requires security to search patient rooms and call police? sounds more like a policy, which could in fact just be changed! and don’t think patients who are sick enough to be hospitalized but well enough to walk out of the hospital won’t due to policies like this.
safe disposal? you sound like your heart may be in the right place but come on, people are not throwing away their drugs! they’re much more likely to just not seek medical care...
who is doing it!?
word. same.

this is really interesting. i would love to talk to you more. it sounds like you emphasized the harm reduction aspect of things and offered abstinence to those who wanted it while my program ordered abstinence and offered harm reduction in small doses every once in a while.

hey recovery addiction harmreduction twitter...have you heard about dialectical harm reduction / combining abstinence-based tx w/ harm reduction principles? i'm writing about this strange theory i encountered at a fl facility & having a hard time finding ppl familiar..are you?
what did they do?!

there is definitely a high co-morbidity but even that doesn't make them the same disorder. i think that saying moud don't treat oud on their own is very dangerous b/c it feeds the narrative that these medicines must be paired w/ therapy in order to be effective.

using drugs for fun/recreationally doesn't typically meet the criteria for addiction, but people who start off using drugs for fun can develop addictions to those substances, and it's not necessarily b/c of an underlying mental health issue.
but ptsd and mental illness are separate diagnoses from addiction.

that's an interesting question. i mean, technically it *is* "trading one drug for another" but the issue is with people saying you're trading one addiction for another...you're not...you're trading one drug you're addicted to for a medication that treats your addiction.

there’s no revelation here, just the sad story about a sweet friendship ending in sexual harassment, an actor gone weird in l.a., and yet another man feeling entitled enough to my time—and confident enough in his appeal—that he persists in texting me for years after repeated nos.

changed a few times, making blocking useless. he began tracking me, through social media i guess (even though we aren’t friends on any platform anymore), sending me messages when he knew i was in cali, for example. recently he texted me for christmas, with this picture. 8/9

he invited me to explore pleasure with him when i decided not to be a prude anymore. for a little bit, the messages stopped. every once in a while he would send me invitations to fly me to cali and “have fun” in a hotel room. he persisted even when i ignored him. his number 7/9

dripping blood from his mouth. film sets...i hope. sometimes they were more basic—no dick pics, but definitely his mouth open, tongue out, thirsty as a boy can be. it was heartbreaking, a betrayal of our friendship, and i told him as much. he accused me of being a prude. 6/9

sometimes the texts and emails were accompanied by photos, usually shirtless. he had grown his hair and beard out, and now liked to wear tight jeans and unbuttoned shirts. one set of photos showed him holding an ornate dagger over a prone, half-naked woman. another showed him 5/9

anything to make me feel uncomfortable in the slightest. i trusted luke. then luke moved to l.a. a few months into it, he started sending me lascivious af texts, inviting me to “explore bodies” with him and break free from the chains of traditional marriage. shit like that. 4/9

with him so i didn’t have to be alone. he also took me out to dinner, and i enjoyed the best meal i had in a while. my husband always thought this guy—call him luke—was into me, but i insisted we were just good friends; he was just a good guy. when i slept over, he never did 3/9

english. his determination was inspiring. he focused on body acting while learning english, for example. i don’t know anyone in my cohort who didn’t love this dude, myself included. at one point, when i was living out of a van and my husband was arrested, he let me crash 2/9

i went to grad school w/ this dude. he was in the acting school, so not part of my writing cohort, but we all loved him nonetheless. he was this super sweet, funny international student from myanmar who plugged along, devoted to acting in the us, even while stumbling over 1/9
this fella really cares about his friend

bothered to tell me the clinic was closing 3-5 days and a full week was being dispensed, i would have dragged myself in. staff never told me. i found out from a concerned patient after the fact. yes, my peers cared about me. my providers did not. memorial healthcare! broward

i worded this poorly. i did miss care due to illness, but extended is a stretch (yeah pun intended bc i suck) and most of the days i “missed “ were due to clinic closures. i was very sick & didn’t want to tax my body for a single dose i’dbe ok w/o, but if someone had (cont)
oh, also, the claim that childnet referred me to residential care somewhere? also false. what the fuck.

just a reminder: this broward county, south florida provider is called memorial outpatient behavioral health, part of memorial regional hospital. i thought they were great when i first started...we all make mistakes.

to the pharmacist that he inform other patients that if they are stable on bupe and relapse once, they can continue dosing w/o waiting first to go into withdrawal. you know. so they continue care. he tried to argue that this was not true. the state of addx tx in 2019 folks!

but really it’s because i’m a journalist. my first month there they brought the director in while i was dosing and she asked me, straight up, “are you here to get treatment or to investigate us?” then accused me of trying to teach patients to overdose b/c i suggested (cont)

to cover their ass and the fact that they removed a patient from care, forcibly withdrew her from buprenorphine with no referral elsewhere (something they claim to never do) and left me to die in the middle of a fentanyl poisoning crisis...all b/c i got the flu.

i accepted the sexual assault counseling info and would have called by now if—oh! i hadn’t been forced into buprenorphine and antidepressant withdrawal over the past month! whomever is creating records that i refused all this is straight up lying, presumably (cont)

b/c of cost and instead recommended urgent care if my flu got worse (it got better). not even sure what appointment w/ this registered nurse is referring to but i certainly didn’t refuse any such thing, i did talk to childnet about the dv issue which is dangerous but i did (cont)

except my *highly personal* choice not to call the police over a marital issue. was i dropped from care b/c i didn’t call the cops, who wouldn’t have helped me anyway? everything else is..straight up false. my counselor actually recommended against going to the ed (cont)

this was my buprenorphine provider..besides claiming i missed an extended period of care when i called out 4 days due to illness (other days i “missed” they were closed for the weekend & in anticipation of a hurricane), literally everything highlighted here is false (cont.)

re-reading the letter that was sent to me by memorial outpatient behavioral health center regarding my forced discharge from care, i am shocked and disgusted by the level and complexity of their lies. these are people who are supposed to provide treatment, and who claimed to care
